results.firPara: Roy Hodgson has spent his career building sides like Iceland, who were the only team to reach the knockout stage at Euro 2016 without a clean sheet
results.secPara: Roy Hodgson has been full of praise for Iceland in the knowledge their defensive organisation follows many principles the England manager admires.
results.webTitle: Where England can exploit Iceland’s weaknesses at Euro 2016 | Michael Cox

results.firPara: Stefan Kuntz remembers the moment well. He says the Euro 96 semi-final between England and Germany at Wembley was the highlight of his career. The 20-year anniversary of the game was on Sunday, and its fair to say the repercussions of the result have been longer-lasting for England than for Germany.
results.secPara: The game had finished 1-1 and it went to a penalty shootout. Kuntz had asked the coach, Berti Vogts, to put him fifth in the list of penalty-takers for one specific reason he was hoping that the shootout would be over by the time it came round to him.
results.webTitle: England and penalties: 20 years of hurt that could continue against Iceland

results.firPara: Striker has spent much of his footballing life at Juventus and is on good terms with many of the Italy players he will be up against in the last 16 on Monday
results.secPara: When Álvaro Morata reaches the Spain dressing room at the Stade de France on Monday afternoon, he will pull on a white shirt, shorts and socks and then put on his boots, his shin pads and a helmet. He will if he has listened to the advice his Italian friends have given him, anyway – and if there is one thing Morata has done recently, it is listen to his Italian friends. Ive learnt more in two years at Juventus than in my entire life, the Spain striker says.
results.webTitle: Spain’s Álvaro Morata prepares to do battle with Italy’s friendly foes

results.firPara: Lionel Messi has said his international career is over at the age of 29 after he blazed a penalty over the bar in Argentinas defeat in the Copa América final to Chile.
results.secPara: The Argentina captain missed his spot-kick in the decisive shootout at Met Life Stadium, which Chile went on to win 4-2 and secure a second Copa crown in two years, and was disconsolate on the pitch after the game.
results.webTitle: Lionel Messi says his Argentina career is over after Copa América final defeat

results.firPara: This was to have been the match that sealed Lionel Messis legacy. The one that silenced the doubters, that killed off the question mark hanging over his greatness, that gave him his place in the pantheon next to Diego Maradona and showed he could achieve the same success with Argentina that has become so staggeringly routine at club level. Instead, it became The Night Messi Missed.
results.secPara: Goalless after 120 minutes, a game that during the first half looked on course to be decided by over-zealous officiating instead had to be settled by penalties. This wasnt the first time the stomach-churning lottery of spot kicks has been needed to separate Argentina and Chile, of course. Last year, it was the heroics of Claudio Bravo and Alexis Sánchezs ice-cool Panenka that clinched the Copa América for La Roja.
results.webTitle: Chile win Copa América once again as Argentina title drought continues

results.secPara: La verdad es que esta victoria es gracias a una enorme actuación de Claudio Bravo. Argentina sigue sin trofeos y que va decir Maradona después de esta noche...Argentina lleva 23 años sin títulos.
results.webTitle: Argentina v Chile: la final de la Copa América – como pasó
